climbs.name: The Sewer
climbs.fa: Alex Garhart and Markus Reitenbach, September 2009

content.description:
Climb 20 feet of runout, slabby pegmatite to a #0.3 Camalot placement in dark rock.  Continue up via fingers and stemming in broken rock to a second band of pegmatite and hand jams up to a large ledge with a pine tree and belay.

This route is an alternate 1st pitch to

Frontal Assault

.
content.protection:
Singles of BD #0.3-3.0, stoppers.  Belay from tree or gear.  To descend, sling tree and rap off or walk left and continue up

Frontal Assault

.
content.location: The route ascends the prow of Jack's Fortress.

climbs.name: Frontal Assault
climbs.fa: Alex Garhart and Markus Reitenbach, May 2009

content.description: Climb fingers and stem in a left facing corner to a ledge where a flake can be reached.  Climb hands and fingers up the flake with nice exposure to a small roof.  Pass the roof on the left via fingers/hands to a small ledge (optional belay).  Move up and right via hands in a crack that cuts through the entire fin.  Surmount the pillar and move left to a couple of airy hand jams to the summit (5.9-, 115 ft).
content.protection: BD: Singles from #0.4 - 4.0, stoppers, slings.  Three bolt anchor.  Rap 100' to the west.  A 60 meter rope is fine for the rap.
content.location: The route ascends the west face of Jack's Fortress.  Start behind a large tree next to a large boulder.  Speak with land owner for access.
